column1: ooh, beauty. Back of a length, angling across the left-hander. Pitches on about middle and leg and nips away off the seam to open de Kock up in defence and beat the outside edge
fuller, wider outside off, left alone
back of a length, fourth-stump line, jabbed to point
shortish, minimal width, chopped down to point
back of a length, and this one nips back into de Kock from a middle-and-leg line with extra bounce. Hurriedly looks to whip it away into the leg side and misses, the ball hits him on the hip
length ball angling in towards off stump, gets on the front foot to clip it watchfully through midwicket
full on off stump, clipped to midwicket

ooh, swing for Thakur too. Beautiful traditional good length, angling into the fourth-stump line and swinging away in a pronounced manner. Rohit doesn't really get forward, just pushes at the drive, aiming towards mid-off, and the ball curves past his outside edge
length ball, a little wider, presses forward to push towards cover point
nicely bowled. Shifts his line wider, but this one isn't quite as full. Goes for the flat-bat drive and is defeated by outswing and bounce
full, late swing to straighten the ball towards off stump. Shows the full face to punch to mid-off
length ball on off stump, gets on the front foot to push into the gap between extra-cover and cover point
back of a length, a bit of nip in towards leg stump. Tucked away towards square leg, where Shardul, sprinting to his right and diving, misfields to allow a single

first boundary of the day, not too convincing. Back of a length, nips back in from outside off, and de Kock goes for a half-front-foot jab, aiming to hit through cover point. Ends up inside-edging it past his off stump instead

got him, Chahar gets the early breakthrough. Takes a premeditated step out of his crease, which turns this short ball into one that isn't quite short enough to pull. He gets cramped a little, and ends up swiping it at catchable height, just over Jadhav's left shoulder, to square leg
back of a length close to off stump, punched to cover
back of a length on off stump, defended towards mid-off

shortish, gets some extra bounce along the fifth-stump channel. Don't know what Suryakumar was trying to do there, trapped between playing and leaving I guess. Jabs at it and gets a thick outside edge that runs down to third man
fullish outside off, and this is not just a bouncy pitch but a bouncy square too. Suryakumar plays a checked drive, into the turf, and it bounces up over the leaping cover fielder

shot! Even better than the previous one. Fullish, angling in towards middle stump, and he keeps his front leg out of the way and is perfectly balanced as he shows the full face and drives to the left of mid-on
short, angling into the batsman's hip. Swivels to pull to fine leg
too much width, way too much width, and Rohit plays a front-foot slap that flies away between point and backward point
short, angling a long way down leg. Rohit can't connect with the pull
slower length ball outside off, punched to the right of Jadhav at cover
back of a length on middle stump, worked away to the left of fine leg
shortish outside off, stops on the pitch a little. Jumps up to slap it, without too much power, into the cover point region

back of a length outside off, and there's a huge gap between cover, who's on the edge of the circle, and mid-off, who's stationed very straight. Suryakumar stands tall and punches it away through that gap

back of a length, angling into the stumps, punched to the right of mid-on, where Rayudu throws himself at the ball but can only get his fingertips to it. Slows it down a little, but not enough to prevent four even with a lung-busting chase to the boundary
back of a length, too straight, and that's clipped away crisply off the pads to the left of midwicket. Met it with a straight bat and didn't really need to close the face at all. Classy shot
back of a length, slower offcutter nipping in towards the thigh pad. Tucked away to fine leg
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and drops it into the cover point region with soft hands
back of a length, delivers from extremely close to the stumps and cuts down any angle the batsman can work with by bowling a tight off-stump line. A bit of inward movement too, clipped to midwicket
back of a length outside off, punched into the cover point region
back of a length on off stump, clipped away to deep square leg
length ball, fourth-stump line, big stride forward to block to mid-off
back-of-the-hand delivery, back of a length and it bounces up a little extra towards off stump. Pulls without too much power to midwicket
back of a length outside off, finds some away movement off the deck  to beat Suryakumar's attempted dab to third man
wrong'un turning towards off stump, driven to long-off off the front foot
another googly, fuller this time, on off stump, clipped to long-on
back of a length, goes on straight towards off stump, lets it come on and works it to deep midwicket
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off
length ball, wide-ish line, not much turn. Opens his bat face to steer to deep point
nice flight and dip outside off. A legbreak with more overspin than sidespin, and Suryakumar plays a checked drive back to the bowler

is that an edge? Dhoni thinks so, and Rohit trudges off. Typical Jadeja wicket, a flat length ball just outside off stump, and it rips away sharply off the pitch as Rohit looks to drive through the covers with an angled bat. They're checking for Jadeja's front foot. He always seems to be on the verge of overstepping while delivering, but usually pulls his leg back so that his heel's behind the crease when the foot lands, even if it's in the air. Looks to be the case here too
flat length ball outside off, presses forward to defend, squeezes it into the gap to the right of short extra-cover
full now, on off stump, driven to short extra-cover
back of a length, comes in with the angle towards middle and leg. Punched to long-on
flat length ball close to off stump, Yuvraj stretches out and blocks watchfully

back of a length, a bit of width, chopped down towards backward point, where Thakur misfields and allows the single, and then nearly concedes overthrows at the striker's end. Thankfully for him, the fielder at deep square leg is alert to the possibility and has backed up well

lovely. Quickish length ball, angled across, pitching on about off stump, and Yuvraj isn't sure which way it's turning as he stretches out to defend. It's the googly, and it slides past his outside edge
shortish on leg stump, pulled to the left of deep square leg

gone! That looked like a clean strike from Yuvraj, and it was, the lofted drive against the full ball on off stump. Frees his arms and it looks like vintage Yuvraj, but long-off is back on the boundary, and Rayudu takes it with both hands, over his head, and even though he's stepping backwards as he takes it he doesn't get too close to the rope. They check a few times anyway, from multiple angles
tossed up, angling away from off stump, gets on the front foot to defend into the covers
flighted ball on off stump, driven back to the bowler
quickish length ball on middle and leg, gets his front pad out of the way to defend back to the bowler
full, angling into middle and leg, driven inside-out to long-off
length ball outside off, defended to short extra
flat, pushed through on off stump, clipped with the turn to midwicket
fired in flat at middle stump, a little fuller. Stays back because of the trajectory and clips to midwicket

the pace on the ball has been his friend so far. Now Krunal turns it into his foe. Quickish length ball pitching just outside off, and that's fast hands to reverse-paddle it between keeper and short third man
back of a length close to off stump, opens his bat face to steer it to the right of backward point
full on the stumps, pushed back down the pitch
too short and he spotted it early, went down and swept it fine. Tahir went for the quicker one but lost his length
tossed up, ends as a full toss and driven to cover
fuller length outside off, driven to long-off
keeps it very full on the stumps again, Krunal drives from the crease to long-off
drags it a little short again, whipped off his pads to deep midwicket
nice looking straight drive to a slower ball on leg stump. He didn't try to hit it too hard though and long-on comes around to collect
gets it wider that time outside off, and Krunal throws his bat at it, trying to drive, but inside edges to short midwicket
length ball outside off, driven to cover, but not timed well enough
went over the top, didn't time it all that well but meaty enough to clear the in-field, which is all he needed because there's no long-off. Full outside off, the bat turned a bit in his hands

that's a pull shot hit hard enough for Rayudu to concede a four despite being behind the ball at deep square leg. Dragged it down a bit and Krunal latched on to it, Rayudu wanted to stop the ball on the bounce, but was on the edge of the boundary and over-stepped while in contact with the ball
length ball, punched back past the bowler
length ball on the stumps, punched to deep midwicket off the back foot
slower ball, length on the fourth stump line, he checks his punch back to the bowler
rolled his fingers over that one again, 115 kph. On a length outside off, pushed towards cover-point

dropped by Mohit at mid-off that was as easy a catch as you can get, he drove it off the toe end straight to the fielder. He tried to grab at it too early perhaps, in and out of his hands. Bravo is not happy
slashed off a thick outside edge, once bounce to third man, who almost fumbles it but recovers in time
full on the stumps, clipped off his toes to midwicket
drilled back straight but Shardul has time to get down and parry it with his right hand and keep the batsmen down to just a single

trapped him in front and the finger's gone up but the batsman has chosen to review. And the replays show why! inside edge onto pad. Length ball that was moving in a touch from outside off, Krunal pushed at it and got a thin edge onto pad, which is the only thing that's saved him, because otherwise that was crashing into the stumps
goes around the wicket and strays on the pads, is picked off to deep square leg
driven between cover and point with an open bat face
angled into the batsman, almost yorker length, he goes deep in his crease and flicks it to short midwicket
goes across and works this to deep square leg from middle stump. And we'll have a strategic time-out
strays on leg stump and is swept to fine leg for a couple

breaks the shackles Krunal was getting tied down, this time he just decided to free his arms. A little slower on the stumps but a touch too full and he clears his front leg and has a big swing to send it well over long-on
driven to long-off
full toss, drifts on the pads, whipped to long-on
quicker ball, drags it too short, and Krunal rocks back to pull powerfully but Raina at midwicket fields it by getting body behind ball

direct hit run out missed? swiped to Raina again, and they take the quick single. He had time to line up the stumps and let loose, but misses and I think Krunal would have been out despite a dive. Oh and replays show he would have just made it.
too full and flicked off his toes between long-on and deep midwicket

oh that's nicely done. was backing away to give himself room, the bowler followed him, but he opened the face from close to his body and steered it wide of short third man. The length was too short, allowed him to adjust
slower ball on fifth stump, he has a swipe at it, sends it along the ground to deep midwicket

very full, low full toss, drilled back straight past the bowler. Jadeja runs quickly from long-off and cuts it off, but almost mis-fields. Recovers quickly and picks up the ball to fire the throw back in
ugly swipe across the line to this slower ball, on a length on middle and leg. The ball loops up off the top edge but lands safe, well in front of deep midwicket
full again, squirted past point
back of a length outside off, he pulls it from there, but without timing, bounces to deep midwicket

just over Jadhav at short third man full outside off, it flies off the outside edge with his attempted drive going nowhere, and Jadhav is running back to try and latch on but the ball not only evades him, it beats him to the fence
just over Watson's head at cover. Krunal should buy a lottery ticket today punch-driven powerfully and Watson jumped up. Was mighty close to his fingertips but goes over and into the fence

he's holed out to long off Krunal's luck has finally run out. Went for another big heave over the off side but got a leading edge that flew high in the air. Jadeja was settling under it and even though the ball was swirling and he had to lunge at the end, he was never letting it go
bang pick up sweep from outside off and he absolutely nails it. Sweet sound off the bat and the ball screams through the air and deep into the square leg stands
too full and driven back straight, but there's a long-on so he'll only get a single
very full again, at normal pace this one, driven off his toes to long-on
well bowled he's got a reputation for bowling slower balls, so what does he do? He bowls a sharp bouncer, and Hardik is very late to spot that, bails out of the shot
very full and normal pace again, he's keeping the batsmen guessing. Full on yorker length, Hardik flicks it fine from between his legs
ther's the slower one, and it's just 92 kph on the fifth stump line. Surya was giving himself room and trying to go over extra cover, misses it completely.
flat bats it straight past the bowler and into the fence. Just misses the yorker, and Surya has drilled it back so straight and so well that it beats even Jadeja's drive

and he's holed out to Jadeja at long-on this time. A slight shimmy down the track and this was another normal pace delivery, Suryakumar wanted to go over cow corner, ends up with a leading edge that Jadeja settles under
get that ball a visa because it's travelling out of here too short and Hardik just stands in his crease, transfers weight back and wallops it waaaaay into the square leg stands

yorker length on the fourth stump line, slashed to point. They were thinking of a second because Dhoni fumbled the ball, but Dhoni ran back down the length of the pitch and forced Hardik to turn back and scramble for his crease. Dhoni under-arms to the stumps but misses, but Hardik would have made his ground. Smiles all around
goes for the wide yorker, but just beyond the tram lines and he'll have to bowl it again
follows it with a bouncer that Pollard ducks under. Well directed, just over his shoulder and not a wide
gets the line right that time, just inside the tram line. Pollard stays rooted to his crease and tries to slam it through the offside, but is forced to reach for it and doesn't connect.
that's a wide again, too far down legside
walloped too short again and not far enough outside off, Pollard's powerful forearms to the fore as he short-arm jabs it well over long-on
full toss on the stumps, flicked to deep midwicket
yorker at 139 kph, helicoptered off his toes to long-on
strays very far down leg, perhaps he was expecting the batsman to give himself room. Ends up as a wide
yorker on fifth stump, squirted to third man
no-ball for height that's gone the distance slipped out of Bravo's hands and above waist full toss. Pollard slaughters it, sends it soaring over the fence over square leg
bouncer for the free hit, pulled from outside off. Gets more height than distance and Deepak Chahar at midwicket drops it. Wouldn't have been out, but concedes an extra run with that drop

helicoptered into the top tier this is some finish by Mumbai. Yorker on the stumps and Hardik goes deep in his crease and pulls out the helicopter, giving Dhoni a great view behind the stumps, and smashes it over cow corner
full outside off and Hardik punch-drives it by opening the face, such great connection that it flies to the extra cover fence
incredible finish by Hardik full outside off and he goes low and slashes it - the timing is so good on it again that it flies all the way over third man. 29 runs off the final over
back of a length, slanting away with steep bounce outside off, left alone
back of a length, closer to off stump this time, punched crisply to backward point
fuller now, angling away from off stump. Looks for the lofted hit over mid-off, ends up slicing it in the air, and on the bounce, to third man

got him, there's the bounce I spoke about! Takes off from a length as it slants away into the fifth-stump corridor, and Rayudu, getting on the front foot to defend, ends up nicking to the keeper off the shoulder of his bat. First-ball duck for him

and he's bowling like he has a red ball in his hand. Back of a length, angling in and straightening away in the fourth-stump channel. Raina is on the hop and looking to defend and the ball beats his outside edge

squared up, huge appeal for caught behind, not given, not reviewed. Unplayable delivery again, angling in, hitting that short-of-good length, and straightening from even closer to off stump, and Raina is spun around in midair as he looks to defend
now it's Malinga's turn to get a bit of swing in the air and a lot of bounce off the wicket. Short outside off, and the bounce beats Watson's slash. And he's overstepped too
just short of a good length, fifth-stump line. Watson looks to hit it over mid-off, and the late outswing causes him to edge thickly and over slip's head

short, wide, slapped, and straight to Pollard! It was there to be slapped away, alright, but he picked out the fielder at point. Anyone else, and it would have comfortably cleared the fielder, but Pollard times his jump well and doesn't even have to reach too far overhead to catch it
length ball curving away outside off, left alone
massive bounce from a pretty full length outside off, and that late outswing too. Wise decision from Jadhav to leave it
shortish, curving away into the fourth-stump channel. Defended towards point
short again, close to off stump, hops up to ride the bounce and defend towards mid-on
back of a length, rising up steeply over middle and leg, hops up to tuck it towards square leg
short, angling down leg, Raina hops across to try and tuck it fine off his hip, but can't make contact
typical Raina. Back of a length outside off, and Raina creates some extra room and carves it away, high over cover
length ball angling into middle stump, stays back and clips to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, shuffles across and clips to the left of square leg
back of a length, pitching within the stumps and angling away from left-arm over. Left alone
back of a length, closer to off stump, defended towards point
length ball, angling away from off stump. presses forward to defend, plays a bit early, off the inside edge towards midwicket
back of a length, slanting away into the fifth-stump channel. Jumps across to dab to backward point
yorker, close to leg stump, flicked to the left of deep backward square leg. There was a chance of a second but both batsmen hesitated while turning and the chance went away
full, too straight, and Jadhav has timed that beautifully. Flicks it off his legs, up and over backward square leg
length ball, a bit of late swing away from off stump. Wanted to clip this through the leg side initially, held his shape and adjusted to play it to mid-off
this is poor bowling with fine leg inside the circle. Again it's full and on the pads, and Jadhav flicks it over the leaping fielder at short fine

shortish, fifth-stump line, and Raina is all over the place with his feet, on the move and in midair while trying to stab it away to third man. Doesn't get any bat on it in the end, beaten by pace and bounce
another rising delivery, angling into middle stump now. Jumps to ride the bounce and keeps it down into the leg side

was that deliberate? Looked awkward, but there was a little opening of the bat face when he played it. Shortish, rising ball in the corridor, and he jumps up and steers it past the keeper diving to his left. Why no slip?
length ball angling into off stump and Raina makes himself room while coming down the track, and carves it away over extra-cover once more
full, almost in the blockhole, angling into off stump, clipped to mid-on

Kieron Pollard, what a catch that is! He seems to pull off one or two of these every season, doesn't he? He's stationed a few yards in on the point boundary, and Raina makes a bit of room and slaps this off-stump length ball ferociously in his direction. It's travelling at high pace, and it's over his head, and by the time he jumps up and catches it, right arm fully stretched over his head, the ball is almost behind him. Still manages to hold on while he tumbles backwards
short, rising ball that nips in off the track to cramp Jadhav as he shapes to cut. Ends up inside-edging into his body
length ball, straightens from a fourth-stump line. Again he was looking to use the initial angle and clip through mid-on or midwicket, ends up adjusting to flick to extra-cover
back of a length, angling into off stump. Extra bounce and a bit of inward movement to beat the flick and hit the thigh pad
back of a length, angling into off stump, steps across to tuck it away through backward square leg
extra bounce from back of a length, angling into off stump. Dhoni plays close to his body and defends into the on side
again, that extra bounce from short of a good length. Bottom hand comes off the handle as Dhoni defends into the leg side
shortish, extra bounce in the corridor and it straightens a touch off the seam too. Jadhav is opened up slightly while defending into the off side
he was setting himself up for this, waiting for it. It's short, a little bit outside off, and he's in position early to pull it away to the right of midwicket
fuller now, angling into off stump, clipped to the left of deep square leg, and it looks like Bumrah's overstepped here

oh my word, that's a super shot! In the blockhole, angling into off stump, and Jadhav goes deep in his crease with his back foot to create a tiny bit of swinging room, and brings out a bottom-hand shovel over mid-on

Jadhav's having fun here. Goes short now, in the fourth-stump corridor, and Jadhav leans back and uses the pace and bounce to ramp it nice and fine, over the man at wide-ish slip. Third man's too square to even dream of stopping this
length ball outside off, shuffles across to jab to backward point
back of a length close to off stump, opens his bat face to dab to backward point
shortish, close to off stump, makes room and cuts but can't beat backward point
legbreak turning away from a good length on off stump. Dhoni presses forward and opens his bat face to squeeze that towards backward point
goes for the wide legbreak outside off. Jadhav throws his bat at the drive but can't connect. De Kock fumbles behind the stumps
nice loop close to off stump, gets on the front foot to block to short extra-cover
another legbreak, on a good length outside off, presses forward and defends into the gap to the left of short extra
short, the turn gives Dhoni lots of width, slapped to the man at deep point
flight and dip outside off, turn too. Didn't pitch full enough for Jadhav to drive inside-out over the covers as intended, but he gets four anyway, thick outside edge to the third man boundary
length ball angling across to off stump, gets forward to ease a checked drive to the right of deep point
back of a length on leg stump, nudged away to deep square leg
full, angling away from off stump. Jadhav shuffles out of his crease before the bowler releases, and across his stumps too, and gets into position to clip it quietly down to long-on
ooh, beauty. Length ball, pitching on about middle and off and nipping away to accentuate the angle away. No feet from Dhoni, just pushes at it and ends up playing inside the line
back of a length on leg stump, looks to flick off his legs but only manages a bit of thigh pad on it, rolls into the square leg region
back of a length, angling across to off stump. Hops across and tucks it away to deep backward square leg
in the blockhole on middle and leg, gets his front leg out of the way and jabs it back to the bowler
back of a length, spinning from middle to off, worked away through square leg
short outside off, Dhoni places his late cut well but doesn't time it at all. Rolls at not very high speed to the right of Malinga at short third man, still forces a dive out of him
back of a length, closer to off stump, opens his bat face and stabs to Malinga at short third man
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away through forward square leg
wrong'un pitching fairly short outside off. Dhoni leaves it alone. Don't know if he picked it
too short and spotted it early, went back to pull. Got it a bit high on the bat, but placed it well, between long-on and deep midwicket, to pick up a couple
length ball on the pads, turned to deep square leg
length ball on the pads again, clipped to the bowler's right
good length on off stump, pushed towards mid-off
length on off, slashed to deep cover
good length on off, Jadhav walks across and clips it towards midwicket
length ball, punched back to the bowler
misses the sweep, wanted to hit it hard, but the ball was a bit flatter and not at the ideal length. Hit on the pads, but that's going down
strays down leg and that'll be a wide
flatter on leg stump, Dhoni pushes it with soft hands into the vacant midwicket region and they pinch two
shimmy down the track and flicked off his toes to wide long-on
low full toss on the pads, whipped to deep midwicket
down the track, giving himself room and swings and misses. Length ball moving away from him
full ball angling into him, picked off his toes to long-on

a bit wider outside off, Dhoni wanted to swat it hard, but gets an under-edge that bounces to the bowler's right. His bat needs some maintenance after that, uses Jadhav's bat to hammer out a few stray pieces
back of a length outside off, he stays legside of the ball and slaps it to deep point
slower ball, on the stumps, Jadhav was coming down the track, forced to adjust and steer it to third man
length ball outside off, squirted to point
on leg stump, turned to short fine leg
oh he completely lost control of that, bowled it way outside off. he'll have to bowl that again
perfectly placed hits the slog sweep square, and fine leg and deep midwicket converge, but the ball beats them to the fence
oooh there's the extra bounce again. takes off from a length, Jadhav wanted to swat it square again, misses. The ball pings the keeper on the shoulder
great bowling, surprise yorker that Jadhav can only jab away
full ball outside off, driven to deep cover
fullish on the stumps, Dhoni stays beside the ball and pushes to mid-off's left for a single
got him short ball and Dhoni was down the track, got a bit cramped for room but went for the pull anyway. Didn't get any timing at all, and pops it straight to square leg. What a day Hardik is having
short ball on off stump, he pulls it to midwicket, keeps it down
length ball outside off, slashed along the ground to third man

brilliant catch by de Kock Jadeja knew he had to go for it, was giving himself room and looking to carve it through the off side, only manages a thick outside edge to this length ball and de Kock dives to his left and plucks out the ball
short ball, Bravo defends it down
bouncer, but down leg side so he'll have to bowl that again
strays on the pads and it flicks them on the way to the fine leg fence
back of a length outside off and Jadhav does nicely to steer it very fine past the keeper to raise his fifty
that's a bit sloppy from Bumrah at fine leg. strays on the pads and he flicks it away. Bumrah is running around from fine leg, but puts in a clumsy half-dive and lets the ball go through
down legside again, and Jadhav tickles it very fine, but Bumrah is very fine too, and he fields
yorker on the stumps, wristed to midwicket
making room to drive though off, but gets a thick outside edge that goes fine. Third man is fine too though, so no boundary
slower ball, length outside off, Bravo tries to slash it but misses completely
on the pads again, but Jadhav can't connect with the flick. The ball takes the pad and rolls to square leg
that has bounced unexpected again. On a length outside off, Jadhav wanted to slash it away, but it bounced much above his bat
good length outside off, steered to third man
sharp bouncer. It was banged in and moving in, Bravo was moving away to give himself room, the ball followed him. went for the hook with eyes off the ball and it whistled past his helmet
back of a length, mistimed pull to midwicket

moving across the stumps, Bumrah bowls a quick one that nips in a touch flicks his pad and goes past the keeper. But they've been keeping the third man and fine leg very fine for Jadhav, so third man is able to run across and field it

and that might be that for CSK's faint hopes. slower ball on the fourth stump, Jadhav wanted to send it to downtown Mumbai, stepping away and swinging mightily, but he can only feather a snick through to the keeper
starts with a yorker on the stumps, that Chahar gets behind and carefully turns to square leg
another slower ball, Bravo gave himself room and wanted to lift this over cover, but doesn't connect again
smashed read hte slower one that time, it was on a half-volley outside off, right in his swinging arc and he frees his arms to send this into the third tier at long-on
another brilliant take by de Kock yorker to Bravo, who gets an inside edge that seems headed to the fine leg fence until Quinton goes airborne to his left and takes a stunning catch
slower yorker, he adjusts and pushes it back to the bowler
almost yorker length on leg stump, moves across and flicks it to mid-on
back of a length, mis-times the short-arm jab that loops up but falls safely, well in front of long-on
where did that come from steps away and smashes this low full toss over extra cover for four
predictable response by the bowler, digs it in short, and Chahar is backing away and trying to swat it, misses completely
backing away again, swishes and misses again. Back of a length passes between bat and body
stays still that time and waits for the ball, pushing it to cover for a single

caught at fine leg Chahar was backing away again, this was another back of length ball that followed him. He made contact this time though and got a top edge. Ironically it's Bumrah who's the catcher. The last over, Chahar had tried the same shot against Bumrah twice but failed to connect

gets it off the toe-end of the bat but manages to hit it just beyond the straight boundary. Full ball on off, free swing of the bat. Doesn't get the timing at all, but just got enough on it for it to carry
he's ending with a flourish at least, ensuring the damage to the net run-rate is minimal. length ball on off and clobbered through extra cover for a well struck boundary
length ball, and he was targetting cow corner, but gets a top edge that loops up high in the air and falls safe - behind the bowler but well in front of long-on
swing and a miss. short ball, backing away and he misses it
back of a length outside off again, it's a hard length and a tailender will miss it more often than not, as Mohit does. That ends that. Mumbai Indians win by 37 runs.
